title: Chesapeake Bay Common Fish
description: 10 most common fish in Chesapeake Bay with appearance and fishery rules.

cards.back: Silver to grayish body with black spots; Season: Year-round; Min Length: 15 in; Daily Limit: 5.
Silvery with dark horizontal stripes; Season: Spring & Fall; Min Length: 28 in; Daily Limit: 2.
Silvery-white body with faint stripes; Season: Year-round; No min length; Daily Limit: 15.
Blue-green back with silver sides; Season: Year-round; Min Length: 12 in; Daily Limit: 15.
Long, snake-like body, dark brown; Season: Year-round; Min Length: None; Daily Limit: 25.
Golden brown with croaking sound; Season: Year-round; Min Length: 8 in; Daily Limit: 15.
Pale gray body with barbels; Season: Year-round; Min Length: None; Daily Limit: 15.
Small, slender silvery fish; Season: Year-round; No limits set; Common forage fish.
Silver with dark spot near gill; Season: Year-round; Commercial limits apply; Not for sport catch.
Silver body with small spots; Season: Spring and Fall; Min Length: 14 in; Daily Limit: 5.

prompt: Create a deck of the ten most common fish found in the Chesapeake Bay and its estuaries. Include only saltwater or brackish fish, no shellfish and no freshwater fish.  Include Spotted Trout in the list.  On the front of each card, put the name of the fish.  On the back, put a brief description of it's appearance and related fishery rules for the species (e.g., Season, Minimum Keep Length, Daily Catch Limit).
